lines: ﻿He glanced down at his audience. Just then a flock of herons flying overhead came and perched on him. Good! Mango remembered that Men welcomed their leader with garlands. So this was a good omen.
Mango raised his hands. He wanted to say, "Brothers and sisters," but the words stuck in his throat. He had cold feet.

In the distance he saw a group of men approaching. They came right up to him. One of them had white-and-black striped tins in his hand, another was armed with brushes. One said to the others, "You lazy louts! How did you miss out this one? Why is there no number on this tree? Shirkers the lot of you!"
He took out some instruments from his bag. "Oh God!" muttered Mango rooted to the ground.
The man began hitting Mango's stomach with his tool. Mango fainted. When he came around he found a rectangle carved on his stomach. On a white background was printed in black the number:
